page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: USK AREA FOOTPATHS - WEATHER There is a Way Marked "Usk Valley Footpath" along the River Usk, across an area called "The Island", through Agricultural College land to a disused and derelict cornmill, Prioress Mill, then passing Llancayo and a ruined Windmill on the other side of the river. Another signed foothpath goes from the Castle Lane, past Castle Farm to Gwehelog, with a branch going through Cwm Cayo Wood down to the Abergavenny Road by Beech Hill Farm. Some foothpaths in the rural area are used by Ramblers as part of long walks, but some are not now used as local short cuts, and are falling into disuse.
